PROCEDURE CODE
1209 
The court decides all the disputes brought before it, unless it postpones their resolution until the judgment of homologation, and gives notice to the parties of their agreements, if any.
Agreements recorded by the Tribunal have the force of the judgments referred to in Article 1043.
The judgment recording the agreement of the parties to the sale, by public auction or by mutual agreement, of all or part of the property empowers the liquidating notary to proceed with the said sale, if he is requested to do so by at least one party.
This judgment confers on the liquidating notary the powers referred to in Article 1224, ¤ 4, paragraphs 2, 3 and 4, the text of which it reproduces in its operative part.
In the case of a public sale of immovable property, the sale takes place in accordance with what is customary for ordinary public sales of immovable property and in accordance with article 1193, paragraphs 2 to 8, and, where applicable, in accordance with articles 1186 to 1192]2.
In the case of a private sale, it takes place, where applicable, in accordance with article 1193bis.
The sale of the movable property takes place in accordance with Articles 1194 to 1204bis, where applicable with the intervention of a bailiff appointed by the liquidating notary.
At the request of at least one of the parties, the sale shall take place on the day indicated for the auction].
